objects.name: HermeticWiper
objects.description: Over the past nine days, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has escalated substantially, including significant increases in cyber attacks. Beginning on Feb. 15, a series of distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks commenced. These attacks have continued over the past week, impacting both the Ukrainian government and banking institutions. On Feb. 23, a new variant of wiper malware named HermeticWiper was discovered in Ukraine.

objects.name: HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
HermeticWiper
Destructive wiper attacks against Ukraine, Latvia and Lithuania
objects.description: On the afternoon of Feb. 23 2022, a malicious file was uploaded to a public malware repository from an organization in Kyiv, Ukraine. This executable is a signed file with a valid signature from an organization named Hermetica Digital Ltd. This signing certificate has since been explicitly revoked by its issuer. Upon execution, this file enumerates all files on a hard drive, wipes the partition info, and then forces a system reboot which predictably results in the operating system no longer being found during the boot process.

objects.name: Destructive wiper attacks against Ukraine, Latvia and Lithuania
